title: Javelin
data:
***Version [0.31](/0.31 "0.31")**: This article **may not be** up to date for the [latest stable release](/0.32 "0.32") of Crawl.*

| Name                                           | Javelin                                        |
| :--------------------------------------------- | ---------------------------------------------- |
| Launcher                                       | [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")               |
| Base damage                                    | 10                                             |
| [Base delay](/Weapon_speed "Weapon speed") (%) | 15 (150%)                                      |
| [Min delay](/Minimum_delay "Minimum delay")    | 7 at [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") skill 16 |

|   |                                                                                                                                                                   |
| - | ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
|   | A lightweight spear, designed for throwing. It will pass through the targets it hits, potentially hitting all targets in its path until it reaches maximum range. |

**Javelins** are the strongest [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") weapons that [medium](/Size#medium "Size")-sized species can use.

Javelins [penetrate](/Penetration "Penetration") through enemies, able to hit every enemy in its path (with no penalty to damage). They may also come with the [silver](/Silver "Silver") brand, which deals extra damage, especially to [chaotic](/Chaotic "Chaotic") enemies.

Javelins have a 5% chance of [mulching](/Mulch "Mulch") when thrown. This destroys the javelin and prevents it from piercing targets, though gives a bonus of +33% damage.

## Strategy

Javelins penetrate, which is a *very* powerful trait.

- They can be used to snipe pesky enemies like [boggarts](/Boggart "Boggart"), [vault wardens](/Vault_warden "Vault warden"), and [shining eyes](/Shining_eye "Shining eye") in the backlines.
- In a hallway, javelins can hit multiple enemies for 100% damage, when only 1-2 enemies can hit you back. For comparison, [Axes](/Axes "Axes") can hit multiple enemies, but at only 70% damage, and every enemy you hit can hit you back.
- Javelins cannot be blocked by enemy [shields](/Shield "Shield").
- Silver javelins are especially effective against chaotic enemies, like [malmutaters](/Malmutate "Malmutate"), [The Royal Jelly](/The_Royal_Jelly "The Royal Jelly"), and [orbs of fire](/Orbs_of_fire "Orbs of fire").

And, because [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing") skill gives more damage than any other weapon skill, a trained thrower can hit multiple enemies at high power. Expect an endgame thrower (20+ skill) to two-shot orbs of fire with silver javelins, for example.

However, javelins are greatly limited by quantity. Use javelins for every fight, and you'll run out quickly. Save them for situations where penetration is actively helpful, and use [boomerangs](/Boomerang "Boomerang") otherwise.

[Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru") can gift throwing implements. If you venture into a [Gauntlet](/Gauntlet "Gauntlet"), then its [minotaur](/Minotaur_\(monster\) "Minotaur (monster)") always carries a stack of javelins. [Urug](/Urug "Urug") also carries a large stack of javelins. The [Shoals](/Shoals "Shoals") is a good place for throwables in general; [merfolk javelineers](/Merfolk_javelineer "Merfolk javelineer") carry a small stack of javelins (around 1-3).

### Tips & Tricks

- Any type of character can benefit from javelins in the early game. They can be used to soften up enemies like [adders](/Adder "Adder") and [ogres](/Ogre_\(monster\) "Ogre (monster)"). However, without much skill, you will throw javelins slowly (i.e. don't throw if an enemy is 1 tile away from you).

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), javelins did not get a damage bonus when mulched, but could pierce targets even if mulched.
- In [0.28](/0.28 "0.28"), javelins were made much less common. [0.29](/0.29 "0.29") further nerfed the javelin gifting rate of [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru").
- Prior to [0.25](/0.25 "0.25"), [Trog](/Trog "Trog") could gift ammunition, including javelins.
- Prior to [0.24](/0.24 "0.24"), javelins did not inherently have the [penetration](/Penetration "Penetration") property. Penetration was one of the potential brands they could have, as well as [poisoned](/Poisoned "Poisoned"), [returning](/Returning "Returning"), and [steel](/Steel "Steel").
- Prior to [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), javelins' throwing speed did not depend on Throwing skill.

| Mundane                                                          | Silver                                                                                |
| ---------------------------------------------------------------- | ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |

| [Weapons](/Weapon "Weapon")                          |                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| ---------------------------------------------------- | -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- |
| [Axes](/Axes "Axes")                                 | [Battleaxe](/Battleaxe "Battleaxe") • [Broad axe](/Broad_axe "Broad axe") • [Executioner's axe](/Executioner%27s_axe "Executioner's axe") • [Hand axe](/Hand_axe "Hand axe") • [War axe](/War_axe "War axe")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |
| [Maces & Flails](/Maces_%26_Flails "Maces & Flails") | [Club](/Club "Club") • [Demon whip](/Demon_whip "Demon whip") • [Dire flail](/Dire_flail "Dire flail") • [Eveningstar](/Eveningstar "Eveningstar") • [Flail](/Flail "Flail") • [Giant club](/Giant_club "Giant club") • [Giant spiked club](/Giant_spiked_club "Giant spiked club") • [Great mace](/Great_mace "Great mace") • [Mace](/Mace "Mace") ([Hammer](/Hammer "Hammer")) • [Morningstar](/Morningstar "Morningstar") • [Sacred scourge](/Sacred_scourge "Sacred scourge") • [Whip](/Whip "Whip") |
| [Long Blades](/Long_Blades "Long Blades")            | [Demon blade](/Demon_blade "Demon blade") • [Double sword](/Double_sword "Double sword") • [Eudemon blade](/Eudemon_blade "Eudemon blade") • [Falchion](/Falchion "Falchion") • [Great sword](/Great_sword "Great sword") • [Long sword](/Long_sword "Long sword") • [Scimitar](/Scimitar "Scimitar") • [Triple sword](/Triple_sword "Triple sword")                                                                                                                                                     |
| [Polearms](/Polearms "Polearms")                     | [Bardiche](/Bardiche "Bardiche") • [Demon trident](/Demon_trident "Demon trident") • [Glaive](/Glaive "Glaive") • [Halberd](/Halberd "Halberd") ([Scythe](/Scythe "Scythe")) • [Spear](/Spear "Spear") • [Trident](/Trident "Trident") • [Trishula](/Trishula "Trishula")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |
| [Ranged Weapons](/Ranged_Weapons "Ranged Weapons")   | [Arbalest](/Arbalest "Arbalest") • [Hand cannon](/Hand_cannon "Hand cannon") • [Longbow](/Longbow "Longbow") • [Orcbow](/Orcbow "Orcbow") • [Shortbow](/Shortbow "Shortbow") • [Sling](/Sling "Sling") • [Triple crossbow](/Triple_crossbow "Triple crossbow")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |
| [Short Blades](/Short_Blades "Short Blades")         | [Dagger](/Dagger "Dagger") • [Quick blade](/Quick_blade "Quick blade") • [Rapier](/Rapier "Rapier") • [Short sword](/Short_sword "Short sword")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                          |
| [Staves](/Staves "Staves")                           | [Lajatang](/Lajatang "Lajatang") • [Magical staff](/Magical_staff "Magical staff") • [Quarterstaff](/Quarterstaff "Quarterstaff")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |
| [Throwing](/Throwing "Throwing")                     | [Boomerang](/Boomerang "Boomerang") • [Dart](/Dart "Dart") • [Javelin]() • [Large rock](/Large_rock "Large rock") • [Stone](/Stone "Stone") • [Throwing net](/Throwing_net "Throwing net")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |
html:
Javelin

From CrawlWiki
Jump to: navigation, search
Version 0.31: This article may not be up to date for the latest stable release of Crawl.
Name Javelin
Launcher Throwing
Base damage 10
Base delay (%) 15 (150%)
Min delay 7 at Throwing skill 16
A lightweight spear, designed for throwing. It will pass through the targets it hits, potentially hitting all targets in its path until it reaches maximum range.

Javelins are the strongest Throwing weapons that medium-sized species can use.

Javelins penetrate through enemies, able to hit every enemy in its path (with no penalty to damage). They may also come with the silver brand, which deals extra damage, especially to chaotic enemies.

Javelins have a 5% chance of mulching when thrown. This destroys the javelin and prevents it from piercing targets, though gives a bonus of +33% damage.

Strategy

Javelins penetrate, which is a very powerful trait.

  • They can be used to snipe pesky enemies like boggarts, vault wardens, and shining eyes in the backlines.
  • In a hallway, javelins can hit multiple enemies for 100% damage, when only 1-2 enemies can hit you back. For comparison, Axes can hit multiple enemies, but at only 70% damage, and every enemy you hit can hit you back.
  • Javelins cannot be blocked by enemy shields.
  • Silver javelins are especially effective against chaotic enemies, like malmutaters, The Royal Jelly, and orbs of fire.

And, because Throwing skill gives more damage than any other weapon skill, a trained thrower can hit multiple enemies at high power. Expect an endgame thrower (20+ skill) to two-shot orbs of fire with silver javelins, for example.

However, javelins are greatly limited by quantity. Use javelins for every fight, and you'll run out quickly. Save them for situations where penetration is actively helpful, and use boomerangs otherwise.

Okawaru can gift throwing implements. If you venture into a Gauntlet, then its minotaur always carries a stack of javelins. Urug also carries a large stack of javelins. The Shoals is a good place for throwables in general; merfolk javelineers carry a small stack of javelins (around 1-3).

Tips & Tricks

  • Any type of character can benefit from javelins in the early game. They can be used to soften up enemies like adders and ogres. However, without much skill, you will throw javelins slowly (i.e. don't throw if an enemy is 1 tile away from you).

History

  • Prior to 0.30, javelins did not get a damage bonus when mulched, but could pierce targets even if mulched.
  • In 0.28, javelins were made much less common. 0.29 further nerfed the javelin gifting rate of Okawaru.
  • Prior to 0.25, Trog could gift ammunition, including javelins.
  • Prior to 0.24, javelins did not inherently have the penetration property. Penetration was one of the potential brands they could have, as well as poisoned, returning, and steel.
  • Prior to 0.18, javelins' throwing speed did not depend on Throwing skill.
Mundane Silver

Maces & Flails Club • Demon whip • Dire flail • Eveningstar • Flail • Giant club • Giant spiked club • Great mace • Mace (Hammer) • Morningstar • Sacred scourge • Whip

Polearms Bardiche • Demon trident • Glaive • Halberd (Scythe) • Spear • Trident • Trishula
Ranged Weapons Arbalest • Hand cannon • Longbow • Orcbow • Shortbow • Sling • Triple crossbow
Short Blades Dagger • Quick blade • Rapier • Short sword
Staves Lajatang • Magical staff • Quarterstaff

{{Flavour|A lightweight spear, designed for throwing. It will pass through the targets it hits, potentially hitting all targets in its path until it reaches maximum range.}}

'''Javelins''' are the strongest [[Throwing]] weapons that [[size#medium|medium]]-sized species can use. 

Javelins [[penetration|penetrate]] through enemies, able to hit every enemy in its path (with no penalty to damage). They may also come with the [[silver]] brand, which deals extra damage, especially to [[chaotic]] enemies.

Javelins have a 5% chance of [[mulch]]ing when thrown. This destroys the javelin and prevents it from piercing targets, though gives a bonus of +33% damage.

==Strategy==
Javelins penetrate, which is a ''very'' powerful trait.
*They can be used to snipe pesky enemies like [[boggart]]s, [[vault warden]]s, and [[shining eye]]s in the backlines. 
*In a hallway, javelins can hit multiple enemies for 100% damage, when only 1-2 enemies can hit you back. For comparison, [[Axes]] can hit multiple enemies, but at only 70% damage, and every enemy you hit can hit you back. 
*Javelins cannot be blocked by enemy [[shield]]s.
*Silver javelins are especially effective against chaotic enemies, like [[malmutate]]rs, [[The Royal Jelly]], and [[orbs of fire]]. 
And, because [[Throwing]] skill gives more damage than any other weapon skill, a trained thrower can hit multiple enemies at high power. Expect an endgame thrower (20+ skill) to two-shot orbs of fire with silver javelins, for example.

However, javelins are greatly limited by quantity. Use javelins for every fight, and you'll run out quickly. Save them for situations where penetration is actively helpful, and use [[boomerang]]s otherwise.

[[Okawaru]] can gift throwing implements. If you venture into a [[Gauntlet]], then its [[minotaur (monster)|minotaur]] always carries a stack of javelins. [[Urug]] also carries a large stack of javelins. The [[Shoals]] is a good place for throwables in general; [[merfolk javelineer]]s carry a small stack of javelins (around 1-3).

===Tips & Tricks===
*Any type of character can benefit from javelins in the early game. They can be used to soften up enemies like [[adder]]s and [[ogre (monster)|ogres]]. However, without much skill, you will throw javelins slowly (i.e. don't throw if an enemy is 1 tile away from you).

==History==
*Prior to [[0.30]], javelins did not get a damage bonus when mulched, but could pierce targets even if mulched.
*In [[0.28]], javelins were made much less common. [[0.29]] further nerfed the javelin gifting rate of [[Okawaru]].
*Prior to [[0.25]], [[Trog]] could gift ammunition, including javelins.
*Prior to [[0.24]], javelins did not inherently have the [[penetration]] property. Penetration was one of the potential brands they could have, as well as [[poisoned]], [[returning]], and [[steel]].
*Prior to [[0.18]], javelins' throwing speed did not depend on Throwing skill.
